a.style: font-family:'Playfair Display', Georgia, 'Times New Roman', 'Liberation Serif', serif

text.tspan: Share of rural vs. urban population with electricity access, 2020
The definition used in international statistics adopts a very low cutoff for what it means to ‘have access to
electricity’. It is defined as having an electricity source that can provide very basic lighting, and charge a phone or
power a radio for 4 hours per day.
Share of urban populations with access
Share of rural populations with access
Data source: Data compiled from multiple sources by World Bank
